utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. No sign of it letting up.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: We’ll just have to be late. Frankly, I’m in no rush to leave this party, thanks to your father’s excellent taste in scotch and daughters.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, the man knows his stuff.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh bugger! Come on.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Must be the storm. Hold on, I know my dad keeps a flashlight here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Is someone trying to break in?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Finis omnium venit est.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: So, the power is out, the phones are down. You know what that means? No late night calls from work to interrupt our game of naked Twister. Wait, why are you so dressed?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got to go to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Now? There’s – there’s nothing more romantic than a blackout.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and nothing more deadly. You know as well as I do that as soon as the lights go out, bad things happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The panic signal from the PI office. I had it set up for when Alexis is there by herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No service.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Captain Beckett to central –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis? What happened? You all right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. That guy broke in with an axe yelling something in Latin and then he just dropped dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. It all happened so fast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that what he broke in with?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yep. Talk about crashing a party. Turns out it’s the fire axe from the downstairs lobby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our intruder must have grabbed it on his way up. But why? I mean, there’s easier ways to break into this office.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, and more silent. He certainly wasn’t planning on sneaking up on anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You get an ID on the guy?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no wallet, and your portable fingerprint thingamajigy is down due to the weather.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: He bled to death from a wound on his left side. My guess is whatever he was stabbed with punctured his subclavian artery. After that he would have had thirty minutes to an hour, tops.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, he came in here with this around … 9PM? He keeled over shortly thereafter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he must have been stabbed between 8 and 8:30. There’s a – there’s a hospital bracelet. Our intruder’s name is G. Shaw and he was a patient at – Peakmore Psychiatric Facility?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yikes.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You know it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a psychiatric hospital for the criminally insane. Our axe wielding psycho is an escaped mental patient.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: The backup generator’s not working so well.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, place like this you’d think would be state of the art.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re here about an escaped inmate. Just tried to kill two people with an axe?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Uh … wait here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I’d try to escape too, if I lived here. Who knows what they’re doing to him back there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can’t be anything worse than what we did historically. Many cultures mistook mental illness for a sign of sorcery. Treatments ranged from, well, prayer to drilling holes in the skull to release the demons.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Definitely a case of the cure being worse than the disease.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: The director’s coming out now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks, man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, he found us. But not before he was fatally stabbed.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: That’s terrible. Gabriel Shaw’s been here at Peakmore for the last twenty years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’d he do?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: He broke into the house of a man named Warren Crowne. Tried to kill him and his entire family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Warren Crowne the philanthropist? I remember the headlines. Didn’t his attacker say he was some kind of avenging angel?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The archangel Gabriel, the divine messenger. Catechism class.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Gabriel was convinced that he was on a mission from God to rid the world of evil. It was a mission that even twenty years of antipsychotic drugs and electroshock therapy could not dissuade him from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any idea who might have wanted him dead?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: None. Gabriel’s contact with the outside world was virtually nil. His room’s down here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any idea how he might have escaped?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Yes, he stole a keycard from one of our orderlies. Uh, we realized he was missing around noon today.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Noon? Why the hell didn’t you call the police before?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: We should have, I realize that now –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man came to my office wielding an axe.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Which is why I sent out a group of orderlies looking for Gabriel. They searched all day and came back empty handed. Except …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Except what?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: One of the orderlies hasn’t come back yet. Dave Holmby. I – I tried calling him but the phones were out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Have Dave and Gabriel had any problems in the past?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: They’ve had … issues, yes. In fact, it was Dave’s keycard that Gabriel stole. But Dave’s been with us a long time. He’s not the type of person to kill anyone, if that’s what you’re thinking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sent an orderly out to recapture a violent, mentally unstable man. It’s possible he was trying to subdue Gabriel and things got out of control.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Dave stabs Gabriel and then loses him in the storm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, are you hearing that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s something in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Might have told me about your rodent problem.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: We don’t have one. Not usually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Must have been driven to higher ground by the storm. Is that a bible?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but with drawings of demons. Page after page of them.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ryan? Javi? Anyone there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Lanie, we’re here. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, get your ass to the morgue. I found something disturbing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, that seems to be going around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what is so … whoa, is that blood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, not according to Lanie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then … what is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Some kind of ink. Lanie sent samples to the lab, but one thing that we do know is based on the writing there’s no way that Gabriel did this to himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So then, someone at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I called, and they said that he didn’t have any writing on him when he escaped this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The roman numerals are bible verses and the words are all in Latin. “Protect me, oh Lord, from the hands of the wicked.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s a prayer for salvation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like he was scared. But of what?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The mysteries don’t stop there. When I conducted the autopsy I found that the wound had been inflicted by some kind of talon or claw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like an animal?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It gets even weirder. There was a strange substance inside the wound.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess: sulfur?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. How’d you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, isn’t it obvious? Latin prayers, a claw, sulfur, also known as brimstone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you don’t think that –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, but I do. We all have our demons. But Gabriel was killed by his.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did I tell you? I mean, as soon as the lights go out bad things happen. You know, at least the precinct is on a backup generator because the rest of the city’s going to have intermittent power. Today’s going to be hell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s appropriate, since that’s the likely place our killer is from. You know, do you think we’re going to need specialized equipment to catch this demon murderer? Something exorcism-esque?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s nothing supernatural about this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our victim was stabbed with a brimstone covered claw. Or gored by a horn, perhaps. Now, what but a demon could do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Ryan and Espo are bringing in Dave Holmby, our rogue orderly, and I am sure that they are going to get a very sane and grounded explanation as to why he killed Gabriel Shaw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seek the truth and thou shall be enlightened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that scripture?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the book of Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hot damn, that was some storm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Seriously. Fit for neither man nor beast. I can only imagine how hard it was to track down an escaped mental patient in the middle of it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that was some Sherlock-level detective work, Dave. NYPD would be lucky to have someone like you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what we should do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get him an application.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, that’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, no, there’s that whole murder issue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If only you wouldn’t have killed Shaw last night after you caught him. Not that I don’t sympathize, I mean, he stole your keycard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were probably going to get fired.

utterance.speaker: DAVE HOLMBY
utterance.content: Wait a minute, when I left Shaw he was still alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, so you admit to seeing him after he escaped?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: Yeah. I – look, he used to talk about this church on 87th Street. So I went up there. There he was, walking out. I grabbed him, I tried to drag him into my car, but –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But what?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: He knew that I was … liberating meds from patients and selling them on the street.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me guess, he told you that if you took him back he was going to rat you out?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: I wish he said that. He promised he was going to out me no matter what.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That sounds like even more of a motive to stab the guy.

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: I swear, I let him go. He was alive at 4:30 yesterday and that was the last time I saw him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So why didn’t you go back to Peakmore? Why were you hiding out at your girlfriend’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: I wasn’t hiding! I figured that Shaw was going to get caught sooner or later which meant that I was out of a job no matter what. So I said, screw it, might as well take the rest of the night off and … you know, spend some time with my girl.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, let’s pretend that that’s true. Why now? After twenty years of confinement why would Shaw decide to break out?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: All I know is that in the past few weeks he was really amped up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why? Something happen to him?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: Not something. Someone. A visitor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But whoever it was really set Shaw off. I mean, he was already disturbed but after this guy came by he got even worse.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So I pulled the police file and court records for Shaw’s prosecution twenty years ago. And according to this, Shaw’s attack on the Crowne family was anything but random. He was working as a consultant for a PI named Noah Kramer.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What kind of consultant?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Spiritual. Kramer had been hired to investigate the Crowne family.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait, wait. Why would a PI hire a spiritual consultant to help investigate a billionaire philanthropist?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know why Shaw came to this office. Twenty years ago this was Noah Kramer’s office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Updating the murder board must mean Holmby’s alibi checked out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That it did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, I’m just excited to get off the whole orderly thing and onto the trail of the true killer. Which is most likely a road paved to hell, because we all know that’s where demons come from.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I will be sure to cross reference Shaw’s visitor against the list of fallen angels, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has Esposito gotten the visitor logs yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he’s trying, but the power outage is slowing everything down. Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, looks just like a lens flare. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There it is again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Weird.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not – – Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, Hayley and I did some digging and twenty years ago Gabriel Shaw worked as a consultant for a PI named Noah Kramer who worked out of your office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then it’s possible that Shaw came there with the axe looking for Kramer.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, it’s a nice theory, but Kramer’s long dead. He was killed in an accident a year and a half after Shaw was committed to Peakmore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of an accident?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was impaled by a pipe that fell at a construction site.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. That’s horrible. But still, it’s possible that Shaw was delusional enough to believe that Kramer was still alive.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Maybe. You know, Kramer’s wife and kids still live in the city. Perhaps they can shed some light on Shaw’s motives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Give me an address for them. Write this down. Hang on, let me get a pen.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA KRAMER
utterance.content: Gabriel Shaw is dead?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: We just saw him yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: Well, he came by the house. He said he was released from Peakmore.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What did he want?

utterance.speaker: MARSHALL KRAMER
utterance.content: He was looking for stuff he left with my dad twenty years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of stuff?

utterance.speaker: MARSHALL
utterance.content: I don’t know, I didn’t ask. We – – we didn’t want anything to do with him. He ruined my dad’s life.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: Marshall’s too young to remember, but he’s well aware of how Gabriel Shaw ruined our family. After Shaw attacked the Crownes my husband’s reputation was destroyed. Noah was shocked to think that a man he befriended could have hidden such … evil. Noah thought the work they did together was a mistake and thought it needed to be buried.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So do you have anything of Shaw’s?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: Oh, no. No. After my husband died I just couldn’t bear going into his office so I hired a company to sell off the furniture and just dump the rest. I told Shaw all of this before he left.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: MARSHALL
utterance.content: Around five o’clock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s still three and a half hours before he met his murderer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Did he mention anything about where he was going next?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: No, but he said something in Latin before he walked away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you remember what that was? It could be very important.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: Finis omnium … I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: MARSHALL
utterance.content: - venit est.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finis omnium venit est.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The end is upon us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The end is upon us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know why Shaw came here wielding an axe last night.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: To commit unholy murder on two unbelievably exceptional women?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Close, but no. He was trying to get in there.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: The safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This was all dry-walled over when I rented the office. The contractors found it when I was doing the renovations. The landlord thought it had been removed, but clearly Noah Kramer walled it up before he died, intent on burying whatever he and Shaw were working on.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s why Shaw grabbed the axe. To try and break into the safe.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So what’s inside?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You’ve never opened – why the hell not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Schrödinger’s cat.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh God, is this another one –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: - great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. It’s – look, if I opened it I was bound to be disappointed with whatever it was that was inside. If I never opened it, literally anything I imagined could be in there.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So you chose fantasy over reality.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, duh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But we’re going to open it now, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, duh. When an axe-wielding psychopath is killed by a demon trying to get inside, clearly whatever’s in there is worth seeing. If only I knew someone who could crack a safe …

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s a Jefferson Titanium 500 vault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I need twenty eight minutes and a chocolate milkshake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Chocolate milkshake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chocolate milkshake.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Chocolate milkshake.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to Peakmore’s visitor’s logs, the person who came to see Shaw was named Dennis Wormwood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, good. Any luck finding him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, because it’s a fake name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, Peakmore must have security video. Pull the feed, see if you can ID him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I did. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. That’s strange.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Creepy is more like it. So do you think Castle’s right about –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. Don’t even add fuel to that fire. Whoever gave the fake name must have sabotaged the video in order to keep that visit a secret, which makes them look even more like our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’ll keep digging.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this – this is – this is loud. I’m going to –

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Got it. Okay, it’s your last chance to let your imagination run wild.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m good.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, maybe we shouldn’t? Given the whole satanic escaped mental patient angle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, we can’t let fear control our actions.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Care to rethink that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What is it all?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like … research.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Into what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The end of days. Which, according to this, is two days from now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, I hate walls of crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if it’s not crazy? Shaw believed the apocalypse starts in two days.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then why did Shaw want to get back inside of here? What was he after?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s a good question. It’s insane to think that this has all been sitting right next to us all this time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s twisted. It looks like they were following this boy, Victor Crowne.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, Crowne. That was the family that Shaw tried to murder twenty years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I looked into them. Warren and Alice Crowne were the parents. They had a nine year old boy named Victor. What’s worse, after surviving Shaw’s attacks they were killed in a freak skiing avalanche and Victor became an orphan.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Poor kid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, yes and no. They were billionaires. Victor stood to inherit the entire fortune.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Guys, tell me you’re seeing this. A targeted orphan, standing to inherit an empire, in the center of religious Armageddon plot? Hello? It’s The Omen. Shaw believed that Victor Crowne was the Antichrist.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The – as in –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As in the personification of the devil, yes, dear. Yes. That’s why Shaw went after the Crownes. He was going after their son.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Except that was a film. Please don’t tell me you’re googling the Antichrist right now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m looking into Victor Crowne. He still lives here in New York.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If Shaw believed that Victor was some sort of devil maybe that’s why he escaped from that institution. So that he could finish his mission.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: According to this article, in two days Victor Crowne turns thirty and gains full control over his parents’ empire.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s it. Jesus began his ministry when he was thirty. Many people believe that the Antichrist will begin his reign on Earth at the same age. And once his ascension has started it cannot be stopped. Guys, what if Victor Crowne is the Antichrist and Shaw isn’t crazy?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, Rick, he was very crazy. Remember, he tried to kill a child.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, we still haven’t accounted for all of Shaw’s time after he escaped. If he’s still obsessed with killing Victor there’s a chance he took a run at him last night.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Except Victor is a full grown man now and able to defend himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If Victor stabbed Shaw in self-defense he might be too afraid to come forward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We need to talk to this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Half the city is blacked out but this place is lit up like a Christmas tree?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The lights probably run on generators.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. Thermoelectric generators fueled by the flames of hell. Check this out, guys. Look at this. Billionaire entrepreneur hell bent on saving the world with his water reclamation project? I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, by all accounts Victor Crowne has helped millions of impoverished people by providing them with clean drinking water.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or is he infecting us with it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Gentlemen, follow me this way, please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You stole this from the safe to protect yourself?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? You guys have guns.

utterance.speaker: VICTOR CROWNE
utterance.content: The NYPD. And Richard Castle, in the flesh. I’m fans of you all.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Yikes. You got a shock. Don’t you hate when that happens? So, how can I help you fine gentlemen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Crowne, we just have some questions about this man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it you recognize him.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Gabriel Shaw. Hard face to forget.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Have you seen him recently?

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Okay, what’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Shaw’s dead. He escaped from Peakmore yesterday afternoon and was killed later that evening.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You seem pleased.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: The man attacked my family, Mr. Castle. You can’t expect me to shed a tear over his demise. Twenty years this face has haunted me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’s that?

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: After his attack, my parents and I left the city. My parents perished in a freak accident on that trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You blame Shaw for their deaths.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: He set those events in motion. That man forever cursed my life. But I’ve turned my pain into a blessing. Channeled all that negative energy into a plan for something good. A better world. My clean water initiative. We’re launching a global network of offices in just a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, on your thirtieth birthday?

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: As it so happens, yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I hate to have to ask you this, Mr. Crowne, but where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Here. Working. Rollins can provide you with surveillance tapes, if you’d like to verify that. We’re done here.

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is that – something smells like –

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Sulfur. We had an accident during a demonstration yesterday. I’m still working out the kinks.

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Detectives, I burned those copies of our surveillance tapes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s with you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look! I’m marked for death!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m marked for death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, you have to stop watching these horror films.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That same slash of light appeared in the crime scene photos, okay? In the exact same place –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - right across my neck. Now it’s showing up in the video feed? That’s live feed! That cannot be manipulated!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, all this stuff about omens and the antichrist …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You being marked for death –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s all in your head.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - it’s all in your head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look out!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were saying?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was a frayed cable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, yes. I agree. If by “frayed cable” you mean Satan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, don’t take this the wrong way, but you’re starting to sound crazy. And not your usual crazy. Next level nutter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, listen to me. I looked into the cold, soulless eyes of Victor Crowne and let me tell you what I saw. Evil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I looked into the surveillance tapes from Victor Crowne’s building and let me tell you what I saw. Victor Crowne, working, all night. He never left the building, Castle. He’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not going to be bound by Earthly laws, Beckett. That’s demon 101.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Cap. We’re still not having any luck finding out where Shaw was during that time of death window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, someone must have seen him, so get unis to recanvass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo, I just got a call from Lanie. Uh, do you remember the Biblical verses painted all over our victim’s body? Well, the lab ran an analysis and the results are … odd. It’s a paste made from a mixture of olive oil, cassia, cinnamon, cymbopogon, and myrrh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cymbopogon and myrrh? I’ve seen this somewhere before, I swear it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey Dad. You wouldn’t believe some of the stuff we’re finding in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you find a recipe?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, for what? Antichrist cookies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course not. But – actually, I don’t even – no, all I know is I saw a letter in here that had a recipe on it with uh, olive oil, cassia, cinnamon, cymbopogon, and myrrh.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait a minute. Why does that sound so familiar? Hold on, hold on, hold on. Um … yeah, here it is. Uh huh. It’s addressed to Gabriel Shaw from a Carl von Ecklund. Now, the letter goes on and on and on about anointing oil that was used in ancient times to prepare the righteous for battle against demons, and the ingredients include cymbopogon and myrrh. Okay, now listen to this part: “find me when it’s your turn to answer the call. I will prepare you for your battle against evil.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who was the guy who wrote that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Carl von Ecklund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We really need to talk to this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, um … he’s dead, so unless you have a Ouija board around here it might be a bit of a challenge.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How did he die?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It looks like he had a fatal heart attack on December 13th, 1996.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ooh, that was just one month after this letter was written.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And a week after Gabriel Shaw was sent to Peakmore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute, if Shaw was institutionalized it’s possible he didn’t know Carl von Ecklund was dead.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Which means, after he broke out he probably went to von Ecklund’s apartment to get prepared for his supposed demonic battle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan, who lives in von Ecklund’s apartment now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His son, Oscar. Looks like he moved in after his father died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice place. It’s very, um … eclectic.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR VON ECKLUND
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s creepy as all hell. But it’s my dad’s old stuff. I never had the heart to get rid of any of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you didn’t follow in your father’s religious footsteps?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Oh, no. It’s all mumbo jumbo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Twenty bucks?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Hey, man’s gotta eat, right? So I make a little money on the side, selling blessed crap to suckers. You know, blessed candles, blessed crosses … Can I interest you in a blessed bracelet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. But uh, we are interested in this man. Was he here last night?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Yeah. Around six. Gabriel something. He was looking for my old man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wanted your father to anoint him with the oil for spiritual battle.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you anoint him, Oscar?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: For fifty bucks? Hell yeah I did. What? I was desperate. So I grabbed one of Pop’s old books and I whipped up a batch of the anointing oil and I uh, wrote some bible verses on him. It gave him great peace.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that peace didn’t last. The man’s dead.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Really? What happened to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was murdered. By the spawn of Satan.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Is he serious?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Very.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Oscar, did Gabriel Shaw tell you whether he was meeting anyone? Did he say where he was going?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: No, he just thanked me and left.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What time did he leave?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: A little after seven thirty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s thirty minutes before Shaw was stabbed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, we’re getting close.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so good and bad news. The good news is we found surveillance footage of Shaw in Oscar’s neighborhood and we were able to track him back to the location where he was stabbed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a video of Gabriel Shaw’s murder?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, yeah … uh … sort of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, this is where the bad news comes in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It appears that due to the thunderstorm none of the cameras are functioning properly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, it’s just going to be sort of … odd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like odd, odd? Or work of the devil odd?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, just odd odd, Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That … is a demon. You guys, you did it. You have video of Gabriel Shaw being killed by something not of this world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Castle. Easy. Look, guys, I – I know it’s late. But I need you to go down to that loading dock and see what you can find. Please?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to go pack up. And um, Castle? It’s just a glitch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “And the beast shall rise and appear as astute and miraculous. The leader comes into power on a platform of prosperity and peace.” Or in a nutshell, Victor Crowne.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not funny, Beckett! I am being targeted by dark forces. I’m serious. I can feel it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Can you just … feel it in the morning? Because it’s late. Let’s go to bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Just … give me a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Boo!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re so easy!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The angel dagger. Where have I seen –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m at the PI office. I figured out why Shaw broke in here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. He was looking for a weapon. It’s the only thing that can kill the Antichrist. It’s called the angel dagger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, would you please just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I’m serious. I found references to it on the internet. It was here. It’s been in the safe the whole time. It’s a blade, it was hidden in a –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s where?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw his eyes. It was a demon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or someone with night vision goggles.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, how much proof do you need before you finally accept the fact that your husband has been marked for death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, if you had been marked for death then the demon would have killed you. Instead you were knocked out by a very human attacker who managed to run off with your … whatever dagger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Angel dagger!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Angel – angel dagger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Angel dagger! Angel dagger. It’s something only a demon would want.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, if that’s true then why did the demon ransack your safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? To look for other items with supernatural abilities. Is it –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey … Castle. How’re you doing, buddy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, boys, I looked into the eyes of the devil, so there’s that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did they check him for a concussion?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, no. He’s fine. He’s just a little shaken. You guys got anything on the canvass?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, a bouncer who was working at a club across the alley from where Shaw’s stabbing took place saw a grey Explorer tear ass out of there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, did you get the plates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope, and we don’t need them. Turns out there’s only one person in this case who has a grey Explorer.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Well a lot of people have that kind of SUV.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, but not a lot of people have the murder weapon in their garage. See, we got a search warrant for your place and uh … we found your garden claw.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, so that explains the claw-shaped wound on Shaw’s body. See, Castle? No demon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah? Then uh, why was there sulfur – i.e. brimstone – found in Shaw’s body?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our lab did an analysis of the murder weapon and not only did they find traces of Shaw’s blood on it, they also found particles of sulfuric gardening fertilizer which matches the sulfur we found in the wound.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: I was just trying to talk sense into him. But Shaw just started rambling about his mission to vanquish evil. He was the true evil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If all you wanted to do was talk, then why did you bring the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: I keep tools from my flower shop in my SUV. And … I don’t know, he just started going on and on. And I grabbed the claw – – twenty years ago that man ruined my family. And I couldn’t let him do it all over again to us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Cramer, why did you break into your husband’s old office last night?

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no reason to lie now. We know you took the angel dagger.

utterance.speaker: SONDRA
utterance.content: What? I was home all night with my son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If she wasn’t the one who attacked me, who the hell did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Any evidence to help identify Castle’s demonic assailant?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. But Rick, whoever attacked you also took all of the files on the Crowne family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That sneaky little devil. It was Victor Crowne. He did this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How do you figure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, clearly he’s trying to take possession of any weapon that could be used against him and erase any and all evidence of his true identity as the spawn of Satan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We already looked into Victor Crowne. He was out celebrating all night at a club for his thirtieth birthday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, who else is going to go to such lengths?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, we don’t know, but they left a souvenir. This was not in the original inventory of the safe’s contents.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo … that’s Oscar von Ecklund’s bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would he want the angel dagger?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because he was in on it the whole time. Do you remember the distorted image of Shaw’s mystery visitor at the psychiatric facility? Well, Vikram was able to clean it up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He said he didn’t believe in all this religious stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He lied. And you all know what that means.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That he’s insane?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, unlike Shaw he has all his faculties. But Oscar, like his father before him, is a true believer. He’s going to pick up where his old man left off. Complete the mission.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Kill the antichrist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oscar’s going to assassinate Victor Crowne.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Rollins, lock down the building and secure Victor Crowne.

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your boss is in danger.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Have you seen this man?

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: That’s the notary who just showed up with legal documents for Mr. Crowne to sign.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you give him access to Mr. Crowne?

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Yes, but not without an escort. Berrea, come in. Berrea, what’s your twenty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did they go?

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Basement. We’re about to start a major renovation. Mr. Crowne’s down there alone, walking the site.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, let’s split up. You two go that way and we’ll go this way.

utterance.speaker: ROLLINS
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Somebody’s down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Castle, drag him upstairs to safety, all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By myself?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oscar! Oscar.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Castle! Do something!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: He is the beast. The lawless one. The son of perdition.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All bad things. But “thou shalt not kill”, remember?

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: He isn’t human so it’s not murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good luck selling that in a court of law.

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: Enough! I have to stop the end of days. I promised my father.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t, Oscar! No!

utterance.speaker: OSCAR
utterance.content: What have you done? If I have to kill you first I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oscar, look out!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle! Where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Over here!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m still good. You?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Now that we all know you’re okay … could someone untie me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: We’re lucky those pipes fell when they did, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, lucky.

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: Thank you for saving me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just to be clear, you’re not really the antichrist, right?

utterance.speaker: CROWNE
utterance.content: I love your sense of humor. You saved my life. That means I owe you, so … whatever you want. Just ask. It’s yours. Okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did I just literally make a deal with the devil?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Oscar’s on his way to Peakmore for a full psych evaluation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, let’s hope they can help him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wouldn’t hold my breath. They didn’t do so great with Shaw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, boss. What’s your husband doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! This is getting out of hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m … still marked for death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah. You’d think saving the antichrist would give you a pass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you mock but you’re going to miss me when I’m gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you be so sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take off your jacket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really don’t think this is the time –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take off your jacket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, now take another selfie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The zipper on your chest pocket. It was catching the light causing a flare.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not marked for death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sound disappointed there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I’m thrilled! Let’s celebrate! Naked Twister.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, I had something else in mind.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We really could have done movie night at my place.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no. We need to get rid of some of the bad vibes in here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So what are we watching? Romcom? Action comedy?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Horror!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No! Oh, come on. We just survived the axe-man. A little Freddy/Jason action will be cathartic.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: All right, but if I can’t sleep tonight I’m kicking your ass in the morning.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: In your dreams.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hayley?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Run.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was genius.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now can we play naked Twister?
